UML:TaggedValue.value: A set of classes that handles different kinds of logging methods. Provided methods include a file based logger that also supports log-rotations and a database based logging engine. Each logging engine is build as a handler to minimize external dependencies. We will also try to make the functionality general enough so it can be used to do event logging and create audit trails.
Interface for all logging mechanism. This can be used by other packages when they want to have logging support but does not want to depend on a specific logging mechanism.
A file logger with support for log rotation.
Controls the maxium byte size of the log file. If this size is exceeded it will perform log rotation. The default values is 200KB.
The maximum number of log rotation files to keep. When a log rotate file exceeds this number it will be removed.
The path to the log file to use for logging strings.
This displays the flow of the log writing and log rotation
